intro: Brachystelma schizoglossoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy environments, where it stores water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow, orange, or red. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and well-draining soil.
